name: Dynamic Programming
description: Questions about dynamic programming concepts, optimization problems, and common DP patterns.

questions.text: What are the two key properties required for a problem to be solved using dynamic programming?
questions.explanation: DP requires optimal substructure (optimal solution contains optimal subsolutions) and overlapping subproblems (same subproblems are encountered multiple times).

questions.text: What is the primary difference between memoization and tabulation?
questions.explanation: Memoization is top-down (recursive with caching), while tabulation is bottom-up (iterative building of solution).

questions.text: Which problem is NOT typically solved using dynamic programming?
options: Finding shortest path in unweighted graph
questions.correct_answer: Finding shortest path in unweighted graph
questions.explanation: Finding shortest path in unweighted graph is typically solved using BFS, not DP, as it doesn't have overlapping subproblems.
